former_owner_as_recorded: Thomas St<?>pe of Cl<?>; in the sale by Hodgson, London, of Edwin Hanson Freshfield (14 July 1949); Isaac Foot, Lord Mayor of Plymouth (1880-1960); acquired with the Foot Collection by the University of California system (1962).
physical_description: Binding: Bound in white vellum over pasteboards.|Script, ff. 1-148v: Gothic.|Layout, ff. 1-148v: 2-column layout with pricking for horizontal lines in both inner and outer margins; center rule between the columns.
note: ff. 1-148v: In same order as Cambridge University Library Ee IV 23: Octateuch, Kings, Chronicles, Ezra, Tobit, Judith, Esther, Maccabees, Psalms, Prophets, Job, Sapiential Books, Gospels (& presumably Acts, Catholic & Pauline Epistles, Apocalypse); some prologues.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

title_as_recorded: Book of Hours, use of Rome
former_owner_as_recorded: Family of Jehan Chacère (1497); Pierre Picard le jeune (1530); Alex Scott Carter, "MS No. 2" (1907); acquired by UC Davis from Francis Edwards at the 8th California Antiquarian Book Faire (September 1972).
physical_description: Binding: Plain red morocco, twentieth century.|Figurative details, ff. 1r-97v: 3 miniatures, of which 2 are retouched.|Script, ff. 1r-97v: Bâtarde.|Layout, ff. 1r-97v: 21-22 long lines ruled in pale red ink.
note: Manuscript note: Exhibited at the Royal Ontario Museum in Toronto in "Books of the Middle Ages" on 10 March 1950.|ff. 1r-97v: Localization to Poitiers suggested by presence of St. Lubin in the litany; on ff. 1v-5v, 101-102, birth & death notices of Chache`re family, 1497-1520, possibly from Auxerre. Large miniature & written space cut from original leaf & re-mounted in window.|ff. 1r-97v: ff. 8-19v Calendar; ff. 20-57v Hours of BVM; ff. 58-69v Penitential pss & litany; ff. 70-91 Office of the Dead; ff. 91v-99v Obsecro te, O Intemerata, suffrages of Michael, John the Baptist, Sebastian, Margaret, Barbara, Stephen, Lawrence, Anne, Mary Magd.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Script, ff. 1r-2v; 3r-4v: Gothic.|Layout, ff. 1r-2v; 3r-4v: 22 long lines.
note: ff. 1r-2v; 3r-4v: Two separate but consecutive leaves numbered 121 and 122 in modern pencil; one bifolium numbered 342 and 343 in modern pencil.|ff. 1r-2v; 3r-4v: Fragment of a story of repentance, penitence and absolution, ff. 1r-2v; apocryphal account of the Apostles' surprise at the empty tomb, ff. 3r-4v.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: 1- and 2-line initals and paraph marks in alternating red and green; headings in red.|Script, f. 1r-v: Gothic.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 2 columns of what were once 48 lines, now 24-25 lines; ruled in ink.
note: f. 1r-v: Contains Ps. 118:43-66 and 91-114 on the two columns of the recto, and Ps. 118:139-162, Pss. 120:4-Ps. 123:6 on the verso.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

title_as_recorded: Commentary on the Liber Sextusof Boniface VIII
former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: Spaces reserved for 2 2-line initials; guide letters present.|Script, f. 1r-v: Gothic minuscule.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 2 columns of 51 lines.
note: f. 1r-v: Commentary on the passage c. Cum in multis tit. De rescriptis (VI 1.3.2); the commentary is not that of the Novellaof Johannes Andreae.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.|f. 1r-v: The identification of the text was kindly provided by Dr. Thomas Izbicki.

title_as_recorded: Life of St. Paternianus, Bishop of Fano
former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Script, f. 1r-v: Gothic.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 2 columns of 29 lines.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: 1- and 2-line initials in red.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 2 columns of 32 lines.
note: f. 1r-v: Probably used as a pastedown.|f. 1r-v: Includes portions of offices for a Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday in Lent.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: Space reserved for large initial "A."|Script, f. 1r-v: Gothic.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 2 columns of once at least 26 lines, 18 remaining; ruled in ink.
note: f. 1v (f. 1r blank except for later additions): Calendar from Paul of Thebes (10 January) to Juliana of Cumae (16 February). Two proverbs from the Distichs of Catoand an alphabet added in a seventeenth-century hand, 1r.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: 1-line initials within text touched in yellow.|Script, f. 1r-v: Gothic.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 2 columns with 11 lines remaining.
note: Manuscript note: Notes of S. Harrison Thomson, f. 1v.|f. 1r-v: Accompanied by notes of S. Harrison Thomson about place and date of origin.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-2v: 3-line initials in alternating red and blue; flourished in faded pink beading and harping; headings, running titles, and contemproary foliation also in faded pink.|Script, ff. 1r-2v: Humanistic with some gothic features.|Layout, ff. 1r-2v: 2 columns of 42 lines; vertical bounding lines ruled in ink, horizontal lines in lead, top line full across.
note: ff. 1r-2v: Bifolium of contiguous but not consecutive leaves, numbered 43 and 48.|ff. 1r-2v: Fragment from Book 3, chapters 9-13 and 23-27 printed in PL 83:681C-687B, 698C-701C.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: 2-line initials in alternating blue with red beading and harping or red with purple beading and harping; initials within text touched in yellow; headings and contemporary foliation in red.|Script, f. 1r-v: Liturgical book hand.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 2 columns of 32 lines; ruled in ink.
note: f. 1r-v: Contemporary foliation in roman numerals; leaf has been used as binding material.|f. 1r-v: Includes the end of the mass of Sts. Marius and Martha (19 January), the mass of Sts. Fabianus and Sebastianus (20 January), and rubric for the mass of St. Emerentiana (23 January).
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Donated to UC Davis Special Collections by Abbey Rents.
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: Large parti-colored red and blue initials with infilling and flourishing in red and blue; one large cadel-work initial.|Number of scribes, f. 1r-v: 1.|Script, f. 1r-v: Imitative of roman font.|Music, f. 1r-v: Square notation on red 5-line staves.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 5 lines of text and music.
note: f. 1r-v: Contains part of the service for a feast of the Holy Cross.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-3v: Paraph marks in red.|Number of scribes, ff. 1r-3v: Several.|Script, ff. 1r-3v: Gothic; hybrida; cursive.
note: ff. 1r-3v: One bifolium from the book itself, in a professional hybrida bookhand; prayers added by others in several other hand on otherwise blank leaves.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v; 2r-v: Initials and headings in red.|Script, f. 1r-v; 2r-v: Gothic.|Layout, f. 1r-v; 2r-v: 2 columns.
note: f. 1r-v; 2r-v: Fragment of a bifolium.|ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: Rubrics (as liturgical directions) underlined in red.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: 1-line red initials in red.|Script, f. 1r-v: Hybrida.
note: f. 1r; f. 1v blank: Rubrics in German; contains a self-contained unit of prayer for the Ascension of Christ on one side of a small square of paper that is blank on the reverse.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: 1 large red initial with pen-flourishing in blue; 1-line initials within text alternating in red and blue; headings in red.|Script, ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: Gothic.|Layout, ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: 2 columns of 31 lines; ruled in ink.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).

note: f. 1r-v: Fragment has been used as binding material.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-2v; f. 3r-v: 2- to 3-line initials in blue with pen flourishing in red and green (?) or ink of text; one gold initial and 1 red initial; headings in red.|Number of scribes, ff. 1r-2v; f. 3r-v: 1.|Script, ff. 1r-2v; f. 3r-v: Gothic.|Layout, ff. 1r-2v; f. 3r-v: 2 columns of 32-33 lines.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).

note: ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: Holes pricked around the sides of the bifolium possibly for sewing that would have made a closed pocket (?) of it, labelled "1551, 1552" and "1551-53 <?>."|ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: Includes sections headed De iracundia De ebrietate De decimis De cupiditatewith quotations on these subjects from the Bible, Ambrose, Isidore, Basil, Augustine, Cyprian, Jerome, Gregory, Caesarius and the Vistaspatrum.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).

note: ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: Bifolium has been used as a pastedown.

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).

former_owner_as_recorded: Acquired by UC Davis Special Collections from Bernard Rosenthal (May 1982).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Number of scribes, f. 1r-v: 1.|Script, f. 1r-v: Gothic.|Layout, f. 1r-v: Two columns of 49 lines.
note: f. 1r-v: Contemporary foliation in roman numerals (xliii) in upper right margin.|f. 1r-v: Reading for the feast of St. Peter from the sermons of Faustus Rhegiensis (PL 58:880C-883B).

physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-2v: 2- to 4-line initials in alternating red and blue with pen-flourishing in other color.|Number of scribes, ff. 1r-2v: 1.|Script, ff. 1r-2v: Gothic.|Layout, ff. 1r-2v: 2 columns.
note: ff. 1r-2v: Stained from turn-ins of book cover in which this fragment functioned as a pastedown.|ff. 1r-2v: On the larger leaf, legends of Cyriacus (8 August), Laurence (10 August), Hippolytus (13 August), Eusebius confessor (14 August), the Assumption (15 August); the text is not that of Jacobus da Voragine, Legenda aurea.

physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Number of scribes, ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: 1.|Script, ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: Gothic.|Music, ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: Square notation on 4-line staves.|Layout, ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: 5 lines each of text and music.
note: ff. 1r-v; 2r-v: Text on the bifolium is not continuous from one leaf to the other.

title_as_recorded: Vita Petrarce|Biography of Petrarch|Epitaphium Francisci Petrarce|Questo e` il sonnetto ritrovato nel sepulchro di Madonna Laura in questo modo
former_owner_as_recorded: Purchased from Bernard Rosenthal, 1990.
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-7v: Headings in red.|Number of scribes, ff. 1r-7v: 1.|Script, ff. 1r-7v: Humanistic semi-cursive.|Layout, ff. 1r-7v: 29 long lines; fragment from parts of 2 quires.|Watermarks, ff. 1r-7v: Winged biped similar to Briquet 2664, Verona 1425-1433.
note: Bibliography: D. Dutschke, "Census of Petrarch Manuscripts in the United States: Supplement I," in Petrarca, Verona e l'Europa: Atti del Convegno internazionale di studi (Verona, 19-23 sett. 1991)ed. G. Billanovich and G. Frasso (Padua: Antenore 1997) 461-463.|f. 1r blank; ff. 1v-7r: Polenton's Vita Petrarceis the last entry (in Book 18) of his Epithoma in vitas scriptorum illustrium latinae linguae.|Explicit, f. 1r blank; ff. 1v-7r: Franciscus Petrarcha florentinus fuit exul nanque patria natus est cuius pater Petrus Petracon mater Leta appellati sunt.|f. 6v: Solerti, Le vitep. 326, here as a quotation set off in red ink internally to the text of Sicco Polenton.|Explicit, f. 6v: Frigida Francisci hic tegit ossa Petrarce.|f. 7v: This sonnet added, s. XVI; followed by note in another contemporary hand, "Copiato il presente sonetto per l'ordene di M <?>."|Explicit, f. 7v: Qui riposa quei caste et felice ossa.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Dawson's Book Shop, Los Angeles (Catalogue n. 203, June, 1946) n. 45a; given to UC Davis by Hobart M. Lovett (February 1955).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound; kept in an envelope from Dawson hand-labelled, "Breviary Leaf; Grolier List."|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: 2-line initials in alternating red and blue.|Number of scribes, f. 1r-v: 1.|Script, f. 1r-v: Gothic.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 2 columns of 22 lines; ruled in ink.
note: f. 1r-v: The Dawson's description retained with the fragment states that it was "written at the Cistercian Abbey at Lucca near Hanover [sic] in the year 1464."|f. 1r-v: Contains part of the offices for the period after Easter.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Edwin Hanson Freshfield (1864?-1948); Isaac Foot (1880-1960), Lord Mayor of Plymouth; acquired with the Foot Collection by the University of California system (1962).
physical_description: Binding: Blind-stamped, reddish-brown calf, fifteenth-century; five metal bosses, one missing on front; triple-braided leather thong, now broken, attached to back with single pin on fore-edge of front for closure.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-243v: Decorative headpieces and 7- to 8-line intials in red at major text divisions; headings, one-line initials in red.|Layout, ff. 1r-243v: 21 long lines, ruled in hard point.
note: Manuscript note: Freshfield's armorial bookplate inside of front cover; Foot's bookplate, f. i.|Bibliography: Kurt Aland, Kurzgefasste Liste der Griechischen Handschriften des Neuen Testaments(Berlin 1963) no. 2641.|ff. 1r-243v: Greek.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Edwin Hanson Freshfield (1864?-1948); Isaac Foot (1880-1960), Lord Mayor of Plymouth; acquired with the Foot Collection by the University of California system (1962).
physical_description: Binding: Bound, s. XVI (?), in red velvet over earlier wooden boards; grove along edges of boards can be verified by feel; headbands in blue and white chevron pattern.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-244v: Decorative headpieces of geometric and interlacing patterns in red and black; 1- to 4-line initials in red, often including a hand or dog-like creature's head.|Layout, ff. 1r-244v: 2 columns of 24 lines except for ff. 1r-2v, which are in long lines.
note: Manuscript note: Freshfield's armorial bookplate inside of front cover; Foot's bookplate inside of back cover.|Bibliography: Kurt Aland, Kurzgefasste Liste der Griechischen Handschriften des Neuen Testaments(Berlin 1963) no. 1983.|ff. 1r-244v: Greek.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Edwin Hanson Freshfield (1864?-1948); Isaac Foot (1880-1960), Lord Mayor of Plymouth; acquired with the Foot Collection by the University of California system (1962).
physical_description: Binding: Red calf over boards with pewter (?) bosses, fifteenth century; remains of triple-braided leather thong on back cover; pin for thong attachment on fore-edge of front cover.|Other decoration, ff. 1r-253v: 2- and 3-line initials in red or ink of text with decoration in void; 1- and 2-line initials in red; headings in red.|Number of scribes, ff. 1r-253v: Several.|Layout, ff. 1r-253v: 23-27 long lines; parchment leaves ruled in hard point.
note: Manuscript note: Freshfield's armorial bookplate inside of front cover; Foot's bookplate on recto of first flyleaf.|Bibliography: Kurt Aland, Kurzgefasste Liste der Griechischen Handschriften des Neuen Testaments(Berlin 1963) no. 2642.|ff. 1r-253v: ff. 1-33, 39-48, and 199-206 of paper.|ff. 1r-253v: Greek.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: Large cadel-work initial; border in red, painted gold, and ink of text.|Number of scribes, f. 1r-v: 1.|Script, f. 1r-v: Calligraphic script.
note: Face: On the dorse, "N. 3 Cassetto 12" and "Cittadinanza di Reggio."|Explicit, Face: Grants citizenship in Reggio Emilia to the Ferrarese nobleman, Count Ercole Mustio of Este and to his descendants.|Docket: Grants citizenship in Reggio Emilia to the Ferrarese nobleman, Count Ercole Mustio of Este and to his descendants.
acknowledgments: Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.

former_owner_as_recorded: Donated to UC Davis Special Collections by Abbey Rents (headed by Stanley S. Slotkin, 1905-1997).
physical_description: Binding: Not bound.|Figurative details, f. 1r-v: Large initial with face as part of letter form.|Other decoration, f. 1r-v: Large parti-colored red and blue initials with infilling and flourishing in red and blue; one large cadel-work initial.|Number of scribes, f. 1r-v: 1.|Script, f. 1r-v: Liturgical book hand.|Music, f. 1r-v: Square notation on red 5-line staves.|Layout, f. 1r-v: 6 lines each of text and music.
note: Manuscript note: Another leaf from the same gradual (or series of graduals) is held by the Los Angeles County Museum of Art with the call number "A.305 - 63.3" in pencil on the paper label on the verso; it contains the sung part of the end of the mass for Augustine of Hippo (28 August; introit, [In medio Ecclesiæ aperuit os eius: et implevit eum Dominus spiritu sapientiæ et intel]lectus: stolam gloriæ induit eum), and the sung part of the mass for the feast of the Decollation of John the Baptist (29 August); historiated initial, L for the introit, "Loquebar de testimoniis tuis" with the letter L formed of a mermaid-like being who holds a basket of flowers on her head, and adjacent to her, the head of John the Baptist on a dish; running headline, Festa Augusti, foliated, 187; the leaf was also a gift to LACMA from Abbey Rents.|f. 1r-v: UCD leaf with rubric, "Festa Novembris" and paginated 215, text reads: “Gaudemus omnes in Domino diem festum celebrantes, sub honore sanctorum omnium de quorum solemnitate gaudent angeli et collaudant filium Dei,” for the Feast of All Saints (1 November).
acknowledgments: Description provided by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke; Peter Kidd supplied the notice of the parallel leaf held by the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.
